The George Brown College offers an Honours Bachelor of Digital Experience Design program. This program includes a digital experience design focus that covers entrepreneurship, service design, user experience design, interaction design, research, project management, business skills, and emerging digital technologies. It is a growing industry with various applications in fields like security, transportation, education, and manufacturing.

Students who have completed at least two years of the Interaction Design advanced diploma at George Brown College or graduated from it with a GPA of 3.2 (75%) or higher are eligible to apply for the summer bridge program leading to the Digital Experience Design degree. The program consists of 18 courses, co-op placements totaling 420 hours, and two years of study. There are also options for Interaction Design students to complete a bridge program and earn an Honours Bachelor of Digital Experience Design or proceed with an Interaction Design and Development Advanced Diploma and then the Bachelor's degree.

Students in this program must complete a 420-hour paid co-op work term between their third and fourth years, which can be done domestically or internationally. The majority of these opportunities are located in the Greater Toronto Area.
